alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong winds will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne and eastern Kit Carson Counties in east central Colorado, northwestern Wallace County in west central Kansas and southwestern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas through 545 PM MDT... At 514 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds from thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Burlington to 14 miles south of Kanorado. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kanorado. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 432 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 163 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
